head.supplied: 17./3./82. ¶ ¶ The byefollowing short paper ¶ may be acceptable to your R. S., ¶ dear Mr Barnard, especially as you have a new part of your next volume under print. Let me hope, that the commenceme...

div.p: RSA/B.13(16), Royal Society of Tasmania Archives, Hobart.
For a summary of this letter, see Papers and proceedings of the Royal Society of Tasmania for 1882 (1883) p. xxvii. 17./3./82.

The byefollowing short paper
B82.13.14. may be acceptable to your R. S.,
Royal Society of Tasmania. dear Mr Barnard, especially as you have a new part of your next volume under print. Let me hope, that the commencement, now made, to elucidate the flora not only of King's Island will be followed up methodically, and that also from other unexplored regions of the Tasmanian dominions collections will come soon forward.
